data.title: The Ohio State Reformatory Preservation Society
data.meta_description: Paranormal Programs Visit one of the most famous haunted prisons in America. Buy TIckets Now Jump to Program: Ghost Walk Mini Ghost Hunt Public Ghost Hunts Private Paranormal Investigation Ghost […]
data.meta_site_name: The Ohio State Reformatory Preservation Society
data.text:
— The Experience —

Walk through some of the most paranormally active areas of the reformatory during this two-hour ghostly tour. As you are guided through these areas, you will hear stories filled with otherworldly experiences.

— Ticket Price —

$45 per person 18 yrs +

$40 per person 13-17 yrs

— Dates —

Select Friday nights from March-August and late November-early December.

— Appropriate For —

For those who want to dip their toe into the world of the paranormal.

— Keep in mind —

A waiver must be completed before the ghost walk. The waiver will be available via the link in your confirmation email. Wear sturdy walking shoes and carry a flashlight. The reformatory is a large structure with many floors and steps. Dress appropriately for the weather. While there are areas of the building that are heated and air-conditioned, it is an old structure with drafts. This is a guided tour and not an investigation.

— Evening Schedule —

The gate will open at 6:45 PM and close at 7:15 PM

Registration 6:45-7:30 PM

A photo ID will be required for registration

The Museum Store hours are 6:45-7:30 PM

Guided ghost walk begins at 7:30 PM

Guests will be assigned to a group

Once your group is filled, the tour will begin

*Guests attending a Ghost Walk MUST be at least 13 years old and accompanied by an adult. Guests 18 and older MUST bring a valid photo ID. Guests 13-17 years old MUST provide a photo ID or proof of age, like a birth certificate (this can be scanned or photographed) or a grade card. Guests who fail to provide photo ID or proof of age may be denied entry.

— The Experience —

Walk the range of the world’s largest free-standing cell block, the East Cell Block. Visit the Chapel, West Attic, East and West Cell Blocks, Solitary Confinement, and Administration for an in-the-dark, eerie experience. Don’t have ghost-hunting equipment? That’s OK, you can rent equipment during the ticket process or the night of your ghost hunt.

— Ticket Price —

$65 per person

— Dates —

Select Friday nights from March-August and late November-early December.

— Appropriate For —

For the inquisitive person who wants to experience a public investigation in a shorter time frame.

Ages 18+

— Keep in mind —

A waiver must be completed before the ghost hunt. The waiver will be available via the link in your confirmation email. Water, coffee, tea, and hot chocolate will be available throughout the night in the break room. Ghost hunting equipment may be pre-ordered during the ticket purchase process or the night of the ghost hunt. Wear sturdy walking shoes and carry a flashlight. The reformatory is a large structure with many floors and steps. Dress appropriately for the weather. While there are areas of the building that are heated and air-conditioned, it is an old structure with drafts. The reformatory staff and volunteers are available all evening to assist you as needed.

— Evening Schedule —

The gate will open at 9:15 PM and close at 9:50 PM

Registration 9:15-10 PM

A photo ID will be required for registration

The Museum Store hours are 9:15-10 PM

Rules and regulations will begin at 10 PM followed by a tour of the reformatory

All guests must be out of the building by 2 AM

— Discounts —

$10 off when a Ghost Walk ticket is purchased for the same date.

— The Experience —

Walk into the paranormal world by experiencing a lights-out public investigation of the reformatory. Bring your senses, with the hopes of a paranormal experience and equipment to confirm what you may be experiencing. If you don’t have equipment, no worries, we have equipment available to rent for the night.

— Ticket Price —

$104 per person

— Dates —

Select Saturday nights from March-August and late November-early December.

— Appropriate For —

Our Public Ghost Hunts are open to all skill levels, from beginners who want to get their toes wet, to more intermediate and experienced investigators.

Ages 18+

— Keep in mind —

A waiver must be completed before the ghost hunt. The waiver will be available via the link in your confirmation email. Water, coffee, tea, and hot chocolate will be available throughout the night in the break room. Outside food is not permitted. The Scofield Cafe will be open during registration. You can purchase “grab and go” sandwiches and chips for the evening. Ghost hunting equipment may be pre-ordered during the ticket purchase process or the night of the ghost hunt. Wear sturdy walking shoes and carry a flashlight. The reformatory is a large structure with many floors and steps. Dress appropriately for the weather. While there are areas of the building that are heated and air-conditioned, it is an old structure with drafts. The reformatory staff and volunteers are available all evening to assist you as needed.

— Evening Schedule —

The gate will open at 6 PM and close at 6:50 PM

Registration 6-6:45 PM

A photo ID will be required for registration

The Museum Store hours are 6-7 PM

Rules and regulations will begin at 7 PM followed by a tour of the reformatory

All guests must be out of the building by 3 AM

*Guests attending a Ghost Hunt MUST be 18 years old. Guests 18 and older MUST bring a valid photo ID. Guests who fail to provide photo ID or proof of age may be denied entry.

— The Experience —

Jump into exploring the ghostly and historical reformatory with a small group of your friends! Walk the building or sit quietly in areas open just for you and experience the eerie, nightly nature of the building.

— Ticket Price —

Friday and Saturday: $3,150 for 30 people or less. The cost is $105/person for more than 30 people. Maximum of 100 guests.

Sunday through Thursday: $1,575 for 15 people or less. Cost is $105/person for more than 15 people. Maximum of 100 guests.

A non-refundable deposit of $500 must be made 2 weeks after placing your investigation on the calendar. The balance due must be made at least 2 weeks prior to your investigation date. Payments are to be made by the organizer only.

— Appropriate For —

The more seasoned investigator and/or groups that want to enjoy the exclusivity of a private event.

Ages 18+

— Keep in mind —

A waiver must be completed before the ghost hunt. The waiver will be sent to the organizer two weeks before the date. Water, coffee, tea, and hot chocolate will be available through out the night in the break room. Ghost hunting equipment is available to rent and may be pre-ordered by the organizer. The Museum Store will be open when requested during the booking process. Wear sturdy walking shoes and carry a flashlight. The reformatory is a large structure with many floors and steps. Dress appropriately for the weather. While there are areas of the building that are heated and air-conditioned, it is an old structure with drafts. The reformatory staff and volunteers are available all evening to assist you as needed.

— Evening Schedule —

The gate does not open earlier than 6 PM

Registration begins when guests arrive

A photo ID will be required for registration

Rules and regulations will begin as soon as all the guests have arrived

An optional tour of the reformatory is available

All guests must be out of the building by 3 AM

— Discounts —

10% off any Private Paranormal Investigation scheduled in January or February.

LED lights allow easy reading of the results and the power on/off status in the dark.

The range that correlates to each color is printed right next to each light in Milligauss and Micro Tesla. Milligauss and Micro Tesla are the units of measure so we know how strong the anomalous and natural readings are. Very simple to use.
